org.aion.api

Interface IContract


  • public interface IContract
    A Contract class that sits above the Aion Java API layer that provides the user with convenient methods of encoding and decoding contract calls and transactions from the Aion Kernel. The IContract interface has no public constructors, instead the user utilizes the IContractController to create the Contract. 
     
 IAionAPI api = IAionAPI.init();
 IContractController cc = new ContractController(api);
 IContractController.createFromSource(String, Address, long, long) or
 IContractController.getContractAt(Address, Address, String)
 

 A factory method for creating a contract object from an ABI Definition and contract address.
 This helper function takes a JSON string of the ABI definition and the Address class represent the contract
 address of the desired contract.
 
 param from
      the class Address represent the sender.
 param contractAddress
      the class Address represent the  contract address.
 param abiDef
      JSON string of the ABI definition
 
 Several factory methods for creating a contract object from smart contract code.
 
 param source smart contract code.
 param from deploy by whom.
 param nrglimit the energy maximum consume for deploy the new contract.
 param nrgprice the unit price for the energy.
 param value (optional) the balance of the the sender's account
 param params (optional) assign parameters when Contract has constructor (function name is the same as contract name),

 
 for deploy
 A multi-contract source, set key value pair when you want to deploy the contract "key" with initial parameters "value".
 
 for class instantiation.
 This class requires the user tp provide an active and connected the class IAionAPI.
    See Also:
    IContractController

    • Method Detail

      • newFunction

        IContract newFunction(java.lang.String f)
        Initiates a new contract function call. Intended usage is to use this function in conjunction with setParam, build and execute to execute a contract function call as a chain call. Intended usage is shown as below : 
         
 IAionAPI api = IAionAPI.init();
 IContractController cc = new ContractController(api);
 cc.createFromSource(contrac_source, deployer, energyLimit, energyPrice)
 IContract c = cc.getContract(contract_address)
 c.build('contract_function')
      .setParam(param1)
 	    .setParam(param2)
 		.setParam(param3)
      .setTransactionGas(value)
      .setTransactionGasPrice(value)
      .setTransactionValue(value)
 		.build()
 		.execute(); //executes function call
        Parameters:
        f - name of the function call by String exactly as it appears in the ABI definition.
        Returns:
        the contract interface IContract.

      • setParam

        IContract setParam(ISolidityArg val)
        Sets a parameter of the function, the order in which this function is called must be in order of the ABI definition. Type and size checks are done in build to ensure parameter order and size are correct.
        Parameters:
        val - the Solidity Type like IInt, IBool or ISString.
        Returns:
        the contract interface IContract.

        Returns:

      • setTxValue

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the contract interface IContract.

      • build

        IContract build()
        Does checks to ensure the function is correct and assembles the transaction hash. Required for execute to operate.
        Returns:
        the contract interface IContract.

      • execute

        ApiMsg execute()
        Executes the built transaction. Refer to newFunction(String) for function use.
        Returns:
        the class ContractResponse containing all relevant information wrapped by the class ApiMsg.

      • getEncodedData

        org.aion.base.util.ByteArrayWrapper getEncodedData()
        GetEncoded gets the input parameters after executed built transaction and then set the return value to TxArgs's data field. TxArgs.
        Returns:
        Bytes array encoded function input parameters.

      • register

        ApiMsg register()
        register the contract events for listening the events set by the method newEvent(String), newEvents(List) and allEvents() to the Aion network and listening events until deregister it.
        Returns:
        the boolean value represent the status of the register wrapped by the class ApiMsg.

      • register

        ApiMsg register(java.lang.String s)
        register the contract events for listening the events set by the method newEvent(String), newEvents(List) and allEvents() to the Aion network and listening events until the given block number as a string.
        Parameters:
        s - the class String represent the block number.
        Returns:
        the boolean value represent the status of the register wrapped by the class ApiMsg.

      • register

        ApiMsg register(ContractEventFilter ef)
        register the contract events for listening the events set by the method newEvent(String), newEvents(List) and allEvents() to the Aion network and listening events until the given block number as a class String.
        Parameters:
        ef - the class ContractEventFilter represent the event listening condition such as the start block number , the end block number, or the specific address.
        Returns:
        the boolean value represent the status of the register wrapped by the class ApiMsg.

      • deregister

        ApiMsg deregister(java.util.List<java.lang.String> e)
        deregister the contract events listening from the Aion network given by the event name.
        Parameters:
        e - the interface List of the class String represent the event name.
        Returns:
        the boolean value represent the status of the register wrapped by the class ApiMsg.

      • deregisterAll

        ApiMsg deregisterAll()
        deregister all of the contract events listening from the Aion network.
        Returns:
        the boolean value represent the status of the register wrapped by the class ApiMsg.
